availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Ingram Hitt (Oldham County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Oldham County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Joel Hitt and Sarah Hitt. Married to Cordelia A. Middleton Hitt in Shelby County, Kentucky, on May 31, 1859. Father of Sarah M. Hitt, James W. Hitt, and Joel N. Hitt. Resident of Oldham County in 1850. Household owned four enslaved persons in Oldham County in 1850. Farmer in Oldham County in 1860. Household owned three enslaved persons in Oldham County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Oldham County, Division 1, p. 141B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Oldham County, Division 1.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Oldham County, p. 171A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Oldham County, Brownsboro, p. 17A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Shelby County Marriages, Film 000259275.
William Ingram Hitt (1835-1903)," Find A Grave, Memorial 142667993, accessed March 8, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/142667993.
